definition: to recite/to repeat from memory
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Rita repeated what Reardon recited when Reardon road the remarks.
sentences.chinese: 当利尔登阅读评论时，丽塔复述尔登背诵的东西。

sentences.english: I would recite all that had been rehearsed on the way home.
sentences.chinese: 我会把在回家路上练习过的东西背诵一遍。

sentences.english: I repeated them until I could recite seventy stories without dropping a word.
sentences.chinese: 我反复背诵，直到我能一字不漏地背出七十篇故事来。

sentences.english: Sixty-three students participated in this contest.
sentences.chinese: 本学期背诵比赛共有六十三位同学参加。

sentences.english: Rita repeated what Reardon recited when Reardon read the remarks.
sentences.chinese: 当里尔登读评论时，丽塔重复里尔登背诵的东西。

sentences.english: My daughter recited the whole conversation in lesson 111 this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上，我女儿背诵了第一百一十一课的全部对话。

sentences.english: Learn and memorize ancient Chinese poems.
Of course, she also recites Too Much Noise once.
sentences.chinese: 当然，她还背诵了一遍《太吵了》。

sentences.english: Yes, the teacher says recitation is real good.
sentences.chinese: 是的，老师说背诵课文真的有好处。

sentences.english: I've been memorizing scripts, regularly since I was about 14 years old.
sentences.chinese: 我从14岁起就开始每隔一段时间就会背诵台词。

sentences.english: Now let's recite the poem we learned last week. Any volunteers?
sentences.chinese: 现在背诵上周学的那首诗。谁自告奋勇？

sentences.english: And also, likewise with the recitations.
In the operating room, Michael is reciting the alphabet.
sentences.chinese: 在手术室内，迈可背诵字母表。

sentences.english: For most people, it takes considerable effort to learn a long poem by heart.
sentences.chinese: 对于大多数人来说，背诵一首长诗需要下很大的力气。

sentences.english: I learn New Concept English everyday, and have recited 5 lessons.
sentences.chinese: 学习新概念英语，背诵课文5篇。
